body: @snowzhangy Hi, How to cover the input image with the obj model?

> @snowzhangy Hi, How to cover the input image with the obj model?

the author has released a demo code (demo@obama) recently. just follow the instruction.
@cleardusk I got the same problem as @snowzhangy . I use the main.py to generate the .mat file. But the result does not work well as yours.
You can check the shape of the generated matrix first. This may be caused by shape dismatch.
@cleardusk  Are you referring to the size of the vertices? Yes, inconsistent sizes. So how do you process the  .mat files?
@cleardusk Not for this reason. When I read the video file, the output vertices size of the frame is (53215, 3), but the .mat file you provided is (46859, 3). So how can we preprocess it?
Use the 53215x3 vertices matrix and `visualize/tri.mat` as triangle indices.

Ok, I will try it!! 
Another question, could the file demo@obama/tri_refine.mat  be applied into  any video? And what does it mean?
Use `tri.mat`, not `tri_refine.mat`. The previous can be applied to any image or video.
